      • getBestMail

        public MailItem getBestMail(int FloorFrom,
                            int FloorTo)
        Description copied from interface: IMailPool
        You are _not_ required to use this method or provide a implementation different to our simple example. You may wish to, however, if you are trying to get a particularly low (good) delivery score. This method treats nonPriority items as priority 0, i.e. lowest priority, and so can return either priority or nonPriority items. You can access information about the Building via its static attributes e.g. Building.FLOORS will return you the total number of floors in that building Read the docs for more information
        Specified by:
        getBestMail in interface IMailPool
        Parameters:
        FloorFrom - the lowest floor in the range to consider
        FloorTo - the highest floor in the range to consider
        Returns:
        a mailItem going to a floor in the specified range: this mail item is the highest priority item which arrived first.

      • getHighestPriorityMail

        public MailItem getHighestPriorityMail()
        Specified by:
        getHighestPriorityMail in interface IMailPool
        Returns:
        the earliest arrived priority mail item from those with the highest priority from the mail pool

      • getNonPriorityMail

        public MailItem getNonPriorityMail()
        Specified by:
        getNonPriorityMail in interface IMailPool
        Returns:
        the earliest arrived nonPriority mail item from the mail pool

      • getNonPriorityPoolSize

        public int getNonPriorityPoolSize()
        Specified by:
        getNonPriorityPoolSize in interface IMailPool
        Returns:
        the number of non-priority items in the mail pool.

      • getPriorityPoolSize

        public int getPriorityPoolSize()
        Specified by:
        getPriorityPoolSize in interface IMailPool
        Returns:
        the number of priority items in the mail pool.
